edu.montgomerycollege.cmsc204.jmeyers

Interface AddressBookInterface<PersonInterface>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AddressBookUtility

    public interface AddressBookInterface<PersonInterface>
    Contains methods of the LookUp Utility. Data Manager Data is stored in a hash table Methods for add, contains, isValidKey, reverseLookup, readFile, writeToFile

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(java.lang.String fName, java.lang.String lName, java.lang.String pNumber, java.lang.String add)
      add Person object to hashtable Valid key is in the form (XXX)XXX-XXXX where X is a digit
      boolean contains(PersonInterface p)
      check if a Person is in the hashtable.
      boolean contains(java.lang.String key)
      check if a Person is in the hashtable by key (phone number) Valid key is in the form (XXX)XXX-XXXX where X is a digit
      boolean isValidKey(java.lang.String s)
      Checks that the String s is a valid key for a Person object Valid key is in the form (XXX)XXX-XXXX where X is a digit
      boolean readFile(java.io.File f)
      create hash table of contents in the file contents of file must be in this format: Firstname[space]lastname[space]phoneNumber[space]address\n phoneNumber must be in the form: (XXX)XXX-XXXX where X is a digit if the phoneNumber is not in the correct format - don't add to the hashtable if the phoneNumber has already been used - don't add to the hashtable
      java.lang.String reverseLookup(java.lang.String key)
      Return the Person object based on the key (phone number) Valid key is in the form (XXX)XXX-XXXX where X is a digit
      boolean writeToFile(java.io.File f)
      write words in hash table to a file

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        boolean contains(PersonInterface p)
        check if a Person is in the hashtable. Uses getKey() to get the key (phone number) for the Person object
        Parameters:
        p - Person object
        Returns:
        true if Person is in the hashtable or false if not

      • contains

        boolean contains(java.lang.String key)
          throws InvalidKeyException
        check if a Person is in the hashtable by key (phone number) Valid key is in the form (XXX)XXX-XXXX where X is a digit
        Parameters:
        key - the key for a Person object
        Returns:
        true if key for Person is in the hashtable or false if not
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - if key is invalid

      • isValidKey

        boolean isValidKey(java.lang.String s)
            throws InvalidKeyException,
                   InvalidKeyException
        Checks that the String s is a valid key for a Person object Valid key is in the form (XXX)XXX-XXXX where X is a digit
        Parameters:
        s - String to be checked if is a valid key
        Returns:
        true if the String s is in the form (XXX)XXX-XXXX, where X is a digit, false if not
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - if key is invalid

      • reverseLookup

        java.lang.String reverseLookup(java.lang.String key)
                        throws InvalidKeyException
        Return the Person object based on the key (phone number) Valid key is in the form (XXX)XXX-XXXX where X is a digit
        Parameters:
        key - the key for a Person object (phone number)
        Returns:
        the string "lastname, firstname" of the corresponding person object, null if key not in hashtable
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - if key is invalid

      • readFile

        boolean readFile(java.io.File f)
        create hash table of contents in the file contents of file must be in this format: Firstname[space]lastname[space]phoneNumber[space]address\n phoneNumber must be in the form: (XXX)XXX-XXXX where X is a digit if the phoneNumber is not in the correct format - don't add to the hashtable if the phoneNumber has already been used - don't add to the hashtable
        Parameters:
        f - File
        Returns:
        true if File is found and Person objects added, returns false if file not found

      • add

        void add(java.lang.String fName,
         java.lang.String lName,
         java.lang.String pNumber,
         java.lang.String add)
  throws InvalidKeyException,
         KeyInUseException
        add Person object to hashtable Valid key is in the form (XXX)XXX-XXXX where X is a digit
        Parameters:
        fName - first name
        lName - last name
        pNumber - phone number
        add - address
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - if key is not in proper form
        KeyInUseException - if the key has already been used

      • writeToFile

        boolean writeToFile(java.io.File f)
        write words in hash table to a file
        Parameters:
        f - File
        Returns:
        true if File can be written to and Person objects in hash table are stored in a file, false if file cannot be written to.
